docs.snippet: Some awards-watchers are finding the timing and placement of several Oscar-related stories in the final days before balloting closes mighty suspicious....
docs.lead_paragraph: Timing counts in everything but horseshoes, as the saying doesn't go, and some awards-watchers are finding the timing and placement of several Oscar-related stories mighty suspicious. "This matter has the distinct smell of awards-season dirty tricks," S.T. Vanairsdale writes in Movieline, about a Los Angeles Times article -reported from Baghdad, Los Angeles and Washington -- in which veterans and military personnel criticize "The Hurt Locker" as inaccurate and disrespectful. (It also smells pretty familiar.)
docs.abstract: Some awards-watchers are finding the timing and placement of several Oscar-related stories in the final days before balloting closes mighty suspicious.

headline.main: The Curious Case of the 'Hurt Locker' Attacks

docs.snippet: The foreign-language Oscar category is often riddled with surprises, and the favorites, like "A Prophet," do not necessarily win....
docs.lead_paragraph: For people looking to fill out their Oscar ballots in the foreign-language category the honest way, by watching the movies, instead of the usual way - by picking the film whose title most makes it seem as if it's about the Holocaust - there is a new screening opportunity starting on Friday. "A Prophet," a French entry that has already nabbed some big prizes globally, including the Grand Prix at Cannes, is "one of those rare films in which the moral stakes are as insistent and thought through as the aesthetic choices," writes Manohla Dargis in The New York Times.
docs.abstract: The foreign-language Oscar category is often riddled with surprises, and the favorites, like "A Prophet," do not necessarily win.

docs.snippet: Hyundai Motor America is recruiting a number of Hollywood stars to pinch-hit for its long-time voice-over announcer, Jeff Bridges, for commercials that will appear during the ABC broadcast of the Academy Awards.The substitution is required because...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hyundai Motor America is recruiting a baker's half dozen of Hollywood stars to pinch-hit for its long-time voice-over announcer, Jeff Bridges, for the automaker's commercials that will appear during the ABC broadcast of the Academy Awards on March 7.
docs.abstract: Hyundai Motor America is recruiting a number of Hollywood stars to pinch-hit for its long-time voice-over announcer, Jeff Bridges, for commercials that will appear during the ABC broadcast of the Academy Awards.The substitution is required because of rules about the broadcast from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

headline.main: With Bridges's Voice Silenced for Oscar Night, Hyundai Turns to the Rest of Hollywood

docs.snippet: A official response to an apparent violation of Academy rules on direct-mail campaigning is expected after Oscar balloting closes next Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: So. All of the close Oscar-watchers of the world are aflutter about an e-mail message that a producer of "The Hurt Locker" sent asking people to vote for his indie movie over another, bigger-budget contender. (Everyone else is sorta like, "Oh, yeah, the Oscars. Is curling still on?")
docs.abstract: A official response to an apparent violation of Academy rules on direct-mail campaigning is expected after Oscar balloting closes next Tuesday.

docs.snippet: Several marketers that were on last year's Oscar broadcast are returning for 2010, among them Hyundai Motor America, Microsoft and J.C. Penney....
docs.lead_paragraph: As the parade of so-called big events on television continues - brought to you by, as the saying goes, a lengthy list of blue-chip advertisers - the marketer line-up for the ABC broadcast of the Academy Awards on March 7 is coming into focus.
docs.abstract: Several marketers that were on last year's Oscar broadcast are returning for 2010, among them Hyundai Motor America, Microsoft and J.C. Penney.

headline.main: Winter Games Not Yet Done, but Oscar Is on Horizon for Madison Avenue

docs.snippet: Bank of America Merrill Lynch said on Friday that it had hired a veteran Lehman Brothers energy banker as the new head of its Houston investment banking office....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bank of America Merrill Lynch said on Friday that it had hired Oscar Brown, a veteran Lehman Brothers energy banker, as the new head of its Houston investment banking office.
docs.abstract: Bank of America Merrill Lynch said on Friday that it had hired a veteran Lehman Brothers energy banker as the new head of its Houston investment banking office.

docs.snippet: In this coming Sunday's Arts & Leisure section, Manohla Dargis takes stock of Jeff Bridges's career and how he has transformed from an "all-American pretty boy with effortless charm to a weathered veteran with bottomless soul."...
docs.lead_paragraph: "At some point on the road to screen immortality," Manohla Dargis writes in this Sunday's appraisal of Jeff Bridges, that Oscar-nominated actor "transformed from an all-American pretty boy with effortless charm to a weathered veteran with bottomless soul."
docs.abstract: In this coming Sunday's Arts & Leisure section, Manohla Dargis takes stock of Jeff Bridges's career and how he has transformed from an "all-American pretty boy with effortless charm to a weathered veteran with bottomless soul."

headline.main: The Dude Plumbs His Weary Soul
